newsitem.title: THAILAND: Amnuay says no intervention in baht.
newsitem.headline: Amnuay says no intervention in baht.

text.p: Thai finance minister Amnuay Viravan said on Wednesday the government had no plans to intervene in the baht despite the strength of the U.S. dollar.
"There is no reason to intervene in favour of the baht because the U.S. dollar is appreciating against all currencies," Amnuay told reporters.
The dollar has risen to a near four-year high against the yen.
Amnuay said the strength of the dollar did not present problems for Thailand, and noted the country still expects foreign capital inflows of about $2.2 billion this month.
"Most analysts forecast that the dollar will maintain its strength to reflect the bullish U.S. economy," Amnuay said.
The Bank of Thailand set the baht/dollar midrate at 25.86 on Wednesday, the lowest level since June 1990.
